I am working on making a wrapper implementation of some REST
webservices fr=
om a PHP project in Java. I have 3 basic packages, the
API package containi=
ng only the interfaces, that are mirrors of the
same objects in PHP. The XM=
L implementation that implements the
interfaces, and collects data via REST=
 web services, and the ehcache
implementation that uses the XML implementat=
ion to fetch data, but
caches it.

Both the XML and ehcache implementation =
implements the same
interfaces, so I would like to write my test once, and =
then run them
over both implementations.

I also have a small problem that =
fetching some off the Objects I am
testing over XML is an expensive operati=
on. I currently fetch objects
in the setUp method, but that gets run before=
 each test method. What
is the prefered way to fetch this object once and r=
euse in all the
tests? The object I am currently working on having this pro=
blem is
immutable, so test won't modify its content.

Finally, the XML test=
 of course requires an URL to fetch data from.
This is dependent on the tes=
t environment. What is the normal way to
set up and read such parameters fo=
r a test?
